name: Whole Smoked Cauliflower
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Smoking cauliflower absorbs just the right amount of smoke that complements your meat without overpowering. This works well with beef, pork, and chicken and the sauce ties it all together. Serve with a dinner salad and you won't even miss the potato.
ingredients: hickory and apple wood chips, as needed
directions: Preheat an outdoor smoker to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
Add hickory and apple wood chips according to manufacturer's instructions
Rub cauliflower head with olive oil and season with seasoned salt and pepper
Place on the rack of the preheated smoker and smoke until tender, about 2 hours
Whisk mayonnaise and barbeque sauce together in a small bowl until smooth
Transfer cauliflower to a serving dish
Drizzle mayo mixture over top before serving
